intro: Loasa puracensis, commonly known as the Andean loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Loasa puracensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous areas.
